Name: Roa Ae
Ingredients: 45 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
15 ml De Kuyper Apricot Brandy liqueur
15 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
15 ml Belle de Brillet pear liqueur
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
Review: Not quite the best, but this long, fruity thirst quencher isn't half bad.
History: Discovered in 2003 at Booly Mardy's, Glasgow, Scotland. Cocktail aficionados will be familiar with the Tahitian phrase Mai Tai - Roa Ae , or 'out of this world - the best', which gave the Mai Tai its name. This cocktail means simply 'the best'.
Nutrition: One serving of Roa Ae contains 250 calories
